botQuickReplyOptions.literalValue: I purchased a product, how do I access it?
I need to purchase a new product

botStepConditions.rightOperandValue: I need to purchase a new product
I purchased a product, how do I access it?

botMessages.message: An email is sent shortly after purchase with next step instructions to get you started with the product.
If you haven't received that email, it is recommended to check junk/spam folders and also confirm that other contacts at your company have not received it either.
I can connect you with someone who can help if you've confirmed that the email was not received or if you have received it but still can't access the product.
RICH_TEXT: Schedule returns in Managed Returns

invocationMappings.value: Monthly filing timeline for Managed Returns

botMessages.message: RICH_TEXT:Monthly filing timeline for Managed Returns
Note that the cutoff for new returns to be setup is the 20th of each month. For more information on this see the following.
When setting up, you have the option to set Automatic filing. If you toggle that off, you will need to log into the product every month and click File for the return to be filed.

To add a return, in the product go to Returns>View and add returns and select Add a tax return. Choose the region or jurisdiction you need to add and fill out the required information. Additional details for setup can be found in the following article.
RICH_TEXT:Schedule your returns in RSB
The details for each step can be found in the following article.
Adding transactions in AvaTax can be completed in a few steps: add & save document details, add line items & price, calculate tax, and set the status of the transaction.
RICH_TEXT: Add a Transaction
Alright, I’ve added that comment to your case for review.
Okay. What would you like to add?

botQuickReplyOptions.literalValue: I need to add a transaction
I need to edit a transaction
How do I credit sales tax on a transaction?

botMessages.message: If you are already registered with SST and filing in at least one state, you can add additional SST states to your registration for filing directly in the product. Full instructions can be found in the following article.
RICH_TEXT:Add additional SST registrations
Ensure you review all notes in the above article as there are many specific rules for SST setup that may impact the filing of your returns.
RICH_TEXT:Review Calculations
This article can also help if you need further details on tax types and what effective date should be set
To add or edit a jurisdiction where you collect tax , in AvaTax go to Settings - Where You Collect Tax. From there you'll be able to select the jurisdiction, tax type, and effective date.

To do so, all transactions for the period must match the expected amounts on the amended return. Prior to requesting an amendment please ensure any missing transactions or credit memos have been added to AvaTax.
If Avalara filed an SST return for the period you need to amend, we will file an amendment on your behalf, free of charge.

Amendment requests can be made by opening a case and providing the following information: -States to be amended -Period to be amended -Reason for amendment -Breakdown of expected refund or additional tax per state & period

RICH_TEXT: Edit a Transaction
The details for each step and a description for each Document Detail can be found in the following article

If a transaction in AvaTax doesn't match the transaction in your business software, find the transaction you want to edit in AvaTax, click the link in the Doc Code column, and select Edit Document Details.

To add a missing transaction in the Avalara system, click Transactions>Transactions from the menu bar, select Add Transaction, and add and save the document details. Further information can be found in the following link.
RICH_TEXT:Manage transactions in RSB

Discrepancies can be caused either by missing transactions or adjustments or credits being applied to a return. For the return in question, click the ellipsis(...) to open the Details and adjustment page to review.
RICH_TEXT: Review and recalculate tax calculation﻿
Review this Calculation on transactions in AvaTax provides a detailed breakdown of how the tax was calculated with tips on next steps if something appears wrong.
You are able to find copies of your invoices in the product by selecting Account>Billing.

botMessages.message: RICH_TEXT:Review Calculations
There are many factors that can effect how tax is calculated on a transaction. This article explains how to review transactions to determine what may be effecting the tax calculation.
Many tax notices are sent to inform you of changes and do not require you to take action or make a payment. If no action is required, simply save a copy of the tax notice for you records.
RICH_TEXT:Resolve tax notices
View the following article for additional details on how each type of tax notice is handled.
All tax notices must be submitted in the product by clicking Returns>Tax Notices. The status for previously submitted notices is only found there as well.

If you've received a tax notice from the state, you will need to work with the state directly to resolve it. Returns for Small Business subscriptions don't include tax notice management or resolution at this time.

Not all tax types are supported via live chat. If your question relates to Communication, Beverage Alcohol, Lodging, Energy, or Tobacco tax, answers to most questions can be found in our help content.
To get additional help, you will need to open a case.
For further details, please refer to the following article.
RICH_TEXT:What is a trade register?
To register for VAT in countries outside of your home country, government agencies require validation of your company's incorporation details which is provided in a trade register.

botStepConditions.rightOperandValue: How do I map tax codes?

botMessages.message: Determining how and where to map tax codes to your items depends on a few factors. Review the tax code mapping guidelines for details.

botStepConditions.rightOperandValue: How do I know whether I need to set specific tax codes?

botMessages.message: Items that aren't mapped to tax codes are taxed at the standard rate for each jurisdiction. Depending on what you sell, this may mean items may be taxed incorrectly.
You can use the Tax Codes Search, to lookup which tax code you should use for the items you sell

botStepConditions.rightOperandValue: How can I setup a custom tax code?
